Welcome to MakkaPakka’s documentation!¶

makka_pakka.elf_caver

Provides the capability to inject shellcode (written in a .asm file) into an arbitrary ELF binary on a Linux system, using code caves as a means of hiding the injected code.

makka_pakka

A programming language which provides addtional functionality onto of traditional assembly (such as functions).
makka_pakka.elf_caver.caver.code_caver._get_end_of_section(section: Section) → int¶

Gets the offset at the end of the passed section :sections: The ELF.Section object to get the final offset of. :returns: The offset at the end of the section.

makka_pakka.elf_caver.caver.code_caver._get_end_of_segment(segment: Segment) → int¶

Returns the offset at the end of a segment. :segment: The ELF.Segment object to get final offset of. :returns: The offset at the end of the segment.

makka_pakka.elf_caver.caver.code_caver._get_executable_segments(segments: Iterator[Segment]) → List[Segment]¶

Filters a list of segments to just those with the executable flag :segments: An Iterator of ELF.Segment objects to be filtered :returns: A list of ELF.Segment objects with the executable flag

makka_pakka.elf_caver.caver.code_caver._get_last_section_in_segment(segment: Segment) → Section¶

Gets the last section in a segment :segment: The ELF.Segment object to get the last section from :returns: The ELF.Section object which was last in the segment.

makka_pakka.elf_caver.caver.code_caver.get_code_caves(binary: Binary) → List[Tuple[int, int]]¶

Gets the code caves from the passed binary. Returns a list of tuples in the format: (code cave offset, code cave size). :binary: The binary to find the code caves in :returns: A list of code caves in the format (code cave offset, code cave size)
